name: Windows 95
funFact: This is one of the most revolutionary versions of Windows, as it introduced the Taskbar and Start Menu

name: Windows 95 OSR2
tooltip: OSR2 brought FAT32 support to Windows 95.
funFact: This update was crucial for supporting large hard drives.

name: Windows XP SP3
funFact: This is the last service pack for XP, as support would end in 2014. There was originally going to be a SP4, but Microsoft never made it as they were focused on Windows 7 development and fixing Windows Vista at the time

name: Windows Longhorn
tooltip: One of the main and very last Longhorn builds.
funFact: The first Longhorn build that had WinFS concept integrated, although, as it caused many problems such as memory leaks, it was reset with the last build being 4093

name: Windows Vista SP2
funFact: Received a lot of criticism on release. Microsoft even tried making a copy of Vista called Mojave, but that also flopped
